Currently, I see enemies present on the map, with one @ (chaser) at (0, 0), a $ (horizontal chaser) at (3, 0), and a % (random) at (0, 9) and (12, 9). The avatar is currently positioned at (6, 9), and there is also an enemy @ at (12, 18).

Since all of the enemies are either too far or pose a threat at their current locations especially above at row 0, taking action to move my avatar will help create distance from the closest enemies.

I will move my avatar DOWN to (7, 9), which is safe while assessing the threat further. 

``` Action:3 ```
Moving down creates potential for more strategic options without putting me in danger from the enemies above. I expect to see if I can create more distance or possibly engage cannon if available near my next location.

- The closest enemies are still far above me at row 0 (@ and %), and one enemy at (9, 18) (#) that is further down but still in range.
- There are bullets available at (6, 8) and (6, 9), which I should utilize.

I will collect a bullet from my current row (7, 9) by moving LEFT to (7, 8). This way, I can stay safer and increase my ammunition supply.

Moving left will help me gather ammunition for countering the threats while keeping my avatar relatively safe in the current layout. I expect this will set me up to potentially engage enemies or further escape if necessary.
